titles.title: Lowering Energy Costs for Manufactured Homeowners Act
Lowering Energy Costs for Manufactured Homeowners Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a refundable tax credit for the addition of skirting to certain manufactured homes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary:
Lowering Energy Costs for Manufactured Homeowners Act
This bill provides a new refundable tax credit in the amount of 20% of the cost of manufactured home skirting, up to a maximum amount of $500. Home skirting is any weather-resistant material used to enclose the space between the bottom of the manufactured home and the ground. The tax credit is not available for taxpayers whose modified adjusted gross income exceeds $150,000 (or $300,000 for joint filers).
